hero.title: Master the SERU Test
hero.description: Prepare yourself for the TFL SERU Assessment with our comprehensive course designed to help you understand Safety, Equality, and Regulatory Understanding. Our course covers everything you need to pass the computer-based test and become a certified PCO driver.

StepSection.title: Book Appointment
StepSection.description: You can begin your PCO licence by booking an appointment on a Thursday evening.

StepSection.title: Medical Check
StepSection.description: You will undergo a TPH204 TFL medical test to ensure you're fit to drive. Our in-house GP will check your medical history and complete your medical.

StepSection.title: Topographical Training
StepSection.description: You will undergo 3 hours of Topographical skills training. We will show you the format of the test and how to navigate and read the London A-Z map.

StepSection.title: Final Steps
StepSection.description: We will complete all necessary application forms and file your application directly to TFL. We will complete everything, making the process hassle-free and simple.

questions.question: To get your licence to be a PHV driver you must be medically fit. The standards you must meet are the DVLA Group 2 medical standards. In most cases, this will mean that you will need to have a medical examination with someone (i.e. a doctor) who has access to your full medical records. You may be exempt for supplying a medical form if you?
options: Have a full or provisional (issued after January 1997) DVLA Group 2 licence.
You have a disability.
You are a citizen or national of an EU country and have a medical form from said country.
questions.answer: Have a full or provisional (issued after January 1997) DVLA Group 2 licence.

questions.question: Keeping children and adults at risk safe from harm and abuse is?
options: Social worker's responsibility
The Police responsibility
Everybody's responsibility
questions.answer: Everybody's responsibility

questions.question: PHV licences last for how many years before the vehicle must have another licensing inspection?
options: 3 years
1 year
3.5 Years
questions.answer: 1 year

questions.question: Which one of the following statements is correct regarding PHV driver's badge?

If we give you an exemption, we will send you an exemption notice.
You must not carry the exemption notice with you at all times when working as a PHV driver.
questions.answer: If we give you an exemption, we will send you an exemption notice.

questions.question: If you lose your PHV driver's badge or licence, or somebody steals it, report it immediately to?

Your operator
The TfL and operator

If you put a cradled device (such as a mobile phone or sat nav) on the area on your windscreen that is covered by your windscreen wipers (known as the 'swept area'), you are committing an offence. options: You can put your phone cradle in any area of the car windscreen
Placing your device cradle on the windscreen swept area you are committing an offence.
Only the swept area of the windscreen can be used as a position for a mobile phone cradle.
questions.answer: Placing your device cradle on the windscreen swept area you are committing an offence.

Race
Pregnancy and maternity

questions.question: A three-point turn or reverse parking are examples of driving?

Manoeuvres
Speeds
Violations

questions.question: As a PHV driver, you offer an extremely important service to the travelling public. You have a responsibility to make sure your passengers feel safe when they travel in your vehicle. The way that you interact with them will affect the way they will feel about their journey with you. It is important that you are professional and deal with passengers in a way that makes them feel at ease. Which one of the following statements is correct?
options: PHVs are not part of public transport
The way that you interact with them will affect the way they will feel about their journey with you.
You must report all complaints to the police
questions.answer: The way that you interact with them will affect the way they will feel about their journey with you.

questions.question: Which of the following is a warning sign of a child at risk?

The child looks concerned or frightened in the company of adults
The child presents as poorly dressed/unclean or malnourished.

questions.question: You should tell the Police immediately if, in between medical examinations, you develop a new medical condition that may affect your ability to drive?

questions.question: Red route signs - meaning?

Parking is limited to the duration specified during the days and times shown

questions.question: The licence discs must not be damaged or changed in any way. You should not remove the discs, even if you are using the vehicle for private purposes. The licence discs contain security features which mean that the discs will be permanently damaged if you try to remove them. Which one of the following statement is correct?
options: You should not remove the discs, even if you are using the vehicle for private purposes.
You should always remove the discs, when using the vehicle for private purposes.
The discs will not be damaged if you try to remove them.
questions.answer: You should not remove the discs, even if you are using the vehicle for private purposes.

Psoriasis

questions.question: Leave room for cyclists at traffic lights. Drivers should not enter the advanced stop line box when the light is red. This space is for cyclists and you may be fined and get points on your driving licence. Which one of the following statement is correct?

Leave little or no room for cyclists at traffic lights.

Without making a judgement about any person's personal characteristics or assuming anything about them

questions.question: During a journey passengers who are visually-impaired, elderly and those with learning disabilities should be told (2 correct answers)

questions.question: Are Muslims allowed to refuse carrying trained assistance dogs?

No, trained assistance dogs may accompany disabled people in PHVs managed or driven by Muslims

questions.question: You are also required by law to tell the DVLA if you change your address. You will then get a new driving licence with your new address on it. options: Your DVLA licence should have the same address as the one on your PHV driver's licence.
You are not required by the law to tell the DVLA if you change your address.
Your driver licence does not contain your home address.
questions.answer: Your DVLA licence should have the same address as the one on your PHV driver's licence.

questions.question: Which action is required if a PHV driver changes their address?

questions.question: What is the legal requirement for accepting guide dogs in PHVs?

Offering a professional and courteous service
Accepting tips as mandatory

questions.question: Which document must be renewed every three years for PHV drivers?
options: Driving licence
Medical certificate
DBS check
Insurance policy

questions.question: Which of the following is required to become a PHV operator?

Good repute and financial standing
Residential address in London
Minimum age of 30

questions.question: Which information must be provided to passengers before the start of a journey?

Displaying company logo

questions.question: What must be done if a passenger leaves property in the PHV?

questions.question: The following characteristics are protected under the Equality Act 2010?

Age, Disability, Gender reassignment, Marriage and civil partnership, Race, Religion or belief, Sex, Sexual orientation, Pregnancy and maternity
Disability, Gender reassignment, Marriage and civil partnership, Race, Religion or belief, Sex, Sexual orientation

questions.question: TfL believes it is important to provide a public transport system which
options: Is the fastest in the world
Is most expensive in the world
All people can use, so that older and disabled people have the same opportunities to travel as all other people
questions.answer: All people can use, so that older and disabled people have the same opportunities to travel as all other people

questions.question: Which scenarios are an example of an adult at risk? (2 correct answers)
options: An adult who seems to be controlled by someone else or is having decisions made for them by another adult
An adult who is constantly on his phone during the journey
An adult who seems to have their money controlled by someone else
answer: An adult who seems to be controlled by someone else or is having decisions made for them by another adult

questions.question: As a driver it is important to: (2 correct answers)

Listen to what adults and children at risk tell you and reassure them by being professional, kind and considerate
answer: Be aware of children and adults at risk and be concerned about their well being
Listen to what adults and children at risk tell you and reassure them by being professional, kind and considerate

TfL may have to suspend or revoke your licence
TfL has no powers to take any action

questions.question: If you change your home address, you should tell TfL within?

Make sure your passengers feel safe when they travel in your vehicle
Know all routes in central London
questions.answer: Make sure your passengers feel safe when they travel in your vehicle

questions.question: Do operators need to keep details of complaints made to them?
options: Yes, details of all complaints
Yes, but only details of complaints involving violent or aggressive behaviour
No
questions.answer: Yes, details of all complaints

questions.question: To help passengers who have a problem hearing or passengers who do not speak much English?
options: Always have a pen and paper with you so that you can write things down
Drop them off at the nearest bus stop
Ask them to call someone who can help
questions.answer: Always have a pen and paper with you so that you can write things down

questions.question: Avoid any behaviour that might be understood as

Being friendly
Being worried

You must wear this badge at all times when you are working as a PHV driver.
You must have your badge with you at all times.
questions.answer: You must wear this badge at all times when you are working as a PHV driver.

questions.question: If your passenger is ill, or has a disability, and asks you to help them enter or leave your vehicle (2 correct answers)
